data: A lexical resource built upon WordNet, which assigns genuine sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word senses (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and news archives of Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset used to understand the sentiment of financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technology, in order to better identify, analyze, and process opinions within this domain.

Incorporates entity sentiment labeling to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities and potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-labeled dataset covers over 10,700 news headlines, providing deep insight into sentiment changes generated by specific entities in financial news.

A dataset containing Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts, which have been scored and labeled. The main goal of this resource is to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A labeled dataset containing relationships within financial documents, extracted from SEC 10-X filing data, with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 types of relationships, covering 8 pairs of entities (e.g., person-title, organization-funding). It is very useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Collected from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price fluctuations, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset, containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. Labels include high-level and low-level topics, making it useful for multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A dataset consisting of question and answer pairs, based on deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it is primarily focused on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data to answer complex financial queries.
